page.title: 10Housing in Egerton
page.content: The area is rural with a mixture of housing dating from the C15 to the 1980s. Most of the older properties are farms or former farms away from the village. There are however some good examples remaining within Egerton village centre. Most are well main_ tained and there are some good ex_ amples of renovation and adaptation to modern use without losing the charact_ er. Most houses are owner occupied although there are a few Borough Council owned houses and a small housing association complex which are tenanted. There are also a few tied homes. Most houses built prior to 1939 have large gardens. All propert_ ies are connected to mains water and electricity. Within the village area sewage is disposed of via a main system. Other properties rely on cess_ pools or septic tanks. No gas mains.
